VisionFeature.Name: Superior Darkvision
VisionFeature.Text: Your darkvision has a radius of 120 feet.

Feature.Name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Feature.Text: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

MultiFeature.Name: Mul Daya Magic
MultiFeature.Text: You know the chill touch cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the hex spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the darkness spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

BonusSpellFeature.Name: Mul Daya Magic
BonusSpellFeature.Text: You know the chill touch cantrip. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

BonusSpellFeature.Name: Mul Daya Magic
BonusSpellFeature.Text: You can cast the hex spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

BonusSpellFeature.Name: Mul Daya Magic
BonusSpellFeature.Text: You can cast the darkness spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

ToolProficiencyFeature.Name: Elf Weapon Training
ToolProficiencyFeature.Text: You have proficiency with the longsword, shortsword, shortbow, and longbow.

SubRace.Name: Mul Daya Elf
SubRace.Description: Elves of the Mul Daya nation of Bala Ged are set apart from other elves by their relationship with the spirits of their elven ancestors. To the Mul Daya, the spirit world and the mortal realm are different only in terms of their tangibility. Death and the spirits of the dead are as much a part of the lives of the Mul Daya as is the natural world. This is not a macabre sentiment to the elves; they simply view it as the truest sense of the natural order. Mul Daya elves can often be recognized by their face painting and tattooing. Many Mul Daya decorate their skins with an enwrapping vine motif, and make use of poisons and acids collected at great cost from strange creatures and plants in the depths of Kazandu.
